QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Capsule endoscopy
QAPair.Answer: Endoscopy is a way of looking inside the body. Endoscopy is often done with a tube put into the body that the doctor can use to look inside. Another way to look inside is to put a camera in a capsule (capsule endoscopy). This capsule includes one or two tiny cameras, a light bulb, a battery, and a radio transmitter. It is about the size of a large vitamin pill. The person swallows the capsule, and it takes pictures all the way through the digestive (gastrointestinal) tract. The radio transmitter sends the photos to a recorder the person wears on their waist or shoulder., A technician downloads the photos from the recorder to a computer, and the health care provider looks at them., The camera comes out with a bowel movement and is flushed down the toilet safely. ,
